qas.question: Who is the lowest ranking person in British India?
Who couldn't be trusted with the power of peace and war?

plausible_answers.text: The Governor General and the council

qas.question: Who had only limited legislative powers?
Who was eventually bankrupt due to their virtual monopoly?

context: <b6_0>Hastings<b6_0/> was entrusted with the power of peace and war. <a1_0><b7_0>British<a1_0/> judges and magistrates<b7_0/> would also be sent to India to administer the legal system. <a0_0><b5_0><b8_0>The <a2_0>Governor General<b5_0/><a2_0/><a0_0/> and the council<b8_0/> would have complete legislative powers. <b9_0>The company<b9_0/> was allowed to maintain its virtual monopoly over <a3_0>trade<a3_0/> in exchange for the biennial sum and was obligated to <a4_0>export a minimum quantity of goods yearly to Britain<a4_0/>. The costs of administration were to be met by the company. The Company initially welcomed these provisions, but the annual burden of the payment contributed to the steady decline of its finances.
